tit.cmt: Domain を大文字にしました。

sen.j: 御所藩（ごせはん）は、大和国葛上郡・葛下郡、和泉国日根郡の一部などを支配した藩。
sen.e: Gose domain was a domain that covered Katsujo-gun and Katsuge-gun in Yamato Province and part of Hine-gun, Izumi-no-kuni.
Gose Domain was a feudal domain that covered Katsujo-gun and Katsuge-gun in Yamato Province and part of Hine-gun, Izumi Province.
sen.cmt: Domain を大文字にしました。Izumi Province としました。
sen.e: Gose Domain was a feudal domain that covered Katsujo-gun and Katsuge-gun in Yamato Province and part of Hine-gun, Izumi Province.

sen.j: 現在の奈良県御所市御所にあった。
sen.e: It was located in present-day Gose, Gose City, Nara Prefecture.
It was located in present-day Gose, Gose City, Nara Prefecture.
It was located in present-day Gose, Gose City, Nara Prefecture.

tit.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 慶長5年（1600年）、桑山重晴の次男・桑山元晴は関ヶ原の戦いにおいて東軍に与し、西軍の大谷吉継隊との戦いで武功を挙げたため、戦後に2000石を与えられた。
sen.e: Motoharu KUWAYAMA, the second son of Shigeharu KUWAYAMA, participated in the Battle of Sekigahara as part of the East camp and received 2000 koku after the war in recognition of his military success against the troops of Yoshitsugu OTANI.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Motoharu KUWAYAMA, the second son of Shigeharu KUWAYAMA, participated in the Battle of Sekigahara as part of the East camp in 1600 and received 2000 koku (an unit of assessed crop yields of the land [1 koku: about 180 liter], which was also used to express the size of the land) after the war in recognition of his military success against the troops of Yoshitsugu OTANI of the West camp.
sen.cmt: 1600年 を追加しました。石（koku) 補足を追加しました。
sen.e: Motoharu KUWAYAMA, the second son of Shigeharu KUWAYAMA, participated in the Battle of Sekigahara as part of the East camp in 1600 and received 2000 koku (an unit of assessed crop yields of the land [1 koku: about 180 liter], which was also used to express the size of the land) after the war in recognition of his military success against the troops of Yoshitsugu OTANI of the West camp.

sen.j: さらに父の重晴からも1万石を与えられて、1万2000石の大名として諸侯に列し、御所藩を立藩した。
sen.e: Combined with 10,000 koku received from his father Shigeharu, Motoharu became a feudal lord with 12,000-koku rice yield and founded Gose domain.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Combined with 10,000 koku received from his father Shigeharu, Motoharu became a daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) with 12,000 koku and founded Gose Domain.
sen.cmt: Domain を大文字にしました。大名 追加しました。
sen.e: Combined with 10,000 koku received from his father Shigeharu, Motoharu became a daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) with 12,000 koku and founded Gose Domain.

sen.j: その後、2000石ほどを父の隠居料として分与したため、1万石となる。
sen.e: Later, the koku yield was reduced to 10,000, when 2,000 was given to his father as retirement stipend.
Later, the koku yield was reduced to 10,000, when 2,000 was given to his father as retirement stipend.
Later, the koku yield was reduced to 10,000, when 2,000 was given to his father as retirement stipend.

sen.j: 慶長11年（1606年）に父が死去すると、その隠居料の内、6000石を与えられた。
sen.e: After his father's death in 1606, he received 6000 koku from the late father's retirement stipend.
After his father's death in 1606, he received 6000 koku from the late father's retirement stipend.
After his father's death in 1606, he received 6000 koku from the late father's retirement stipend.

sen.j: さらに慶長14年（1609年）には長男の桑山清晴の所領であった和泉谷川藩領も、改易のときにその所領1万石を継ぐことを許されたため、御所藩の所領は2万6000石となった。
sen.e: Furthermore, Gose domain acquired 10,000 more koku with the forfeiture of Izumi Tanigawa domain that had been held by the eldest son Kiyoharu KUWAYAMA in 1609, growing to 26,000 koku.
Furthermore, Gose Domain acquired 10,000 more koku with the forfeiture of Izumi Tanigawa Domain that had been held by the eldest son Kiyoharu KUWAYAMA in 1609, growing to 26,000 koku.
sen.cmt: Domain を大文字にしました。
sen.e: Furthermore, Gose Domain acquired 10,000 more koku with the forfeiture of Izumi Tanigawa Domain that had been held by the eldest son Kiyoharu KUWAYAMA in 1609, growing to 26,000 koku.

sen.j: 元晴は大坂の陣においても徳川方として奮戦し、戦後は高力忠房と共に大坂方の残党狩りを務めた。
sen.e: Motoharu also fought with the Tokugawa camp in the Siege of Osaka and served after the war in hunting down Osaka Castle survivors, alongside Tadafusa KORIKI.
Motoharu also fought with the Tokugawa camp in the Siege of Osaka and served after the war in hunting down survivors of Osaka (Toyotomi) side, together with Tadafusa KORIKI.
sen.cmt: 大阪方→Osaka (Toyotomi) side と補足を追加しました。
sen.e: Motoharu also fought with the Tokugawa camp in the Siege of Osaka and served after the war in hunting down survivors of Osaka (Toyotomi) side, together with Tadafusa KORIKI.

sen.j: 元晴は元和 (日本)6年（1620年）に死去し、後を次男の桑山貞晴が継ぐが、貞晴は嗣子の無いまま寛永6年（1629年）に死去する。
sen.e: Motoharu died in 1620, leaving the family heritage to his second son Sadaharu KUWAYAMA, who in turn died in 1629 without leaving an heir.
Motoharu died in 1620, leaving the family heritage to his second son Sadaharu KUWAYAMA, who in turn died in 1629 without leaving an heir.
Motoharu died in 1620, leaving the family heritage to his second son Sadaharu KUWAYAMA, who in turn died in 1629 without leaving an heir.

sen.j: 貞晴は弟の桑山栄晴を末期養子として継がせようとしたが認められず、ここに御所藩は廃藩、その所領は天領となった。
sen.e: Although Sadaharu in his deathbed tried to have his younger brother Hideharu to be adopted as his son, this was not accepted, resulting in Gose domain being closed and becoming shogunate property.
Although Sadaharu in his deathbed tried to have his younger brother Hideharu KUWAYAMA adopted as his son, this was not accepted, resulting in Gose Domain being closed and becoming shogunate property.
Although Sadaharu in his deathbed tried to have his younger brother Hideharu KUWAYAMA adopted as his son, this was not accepted, resulting in Gose Domain being closed and becoming shogunate property.

sen.j: その後、栄晴は500俵扶持の旗本として名跡存続だけは許された。
sen.e: Later, Hideharu was granted preservation of the family name and given status as hatamoto with 500 bales of rice.
Later, Hideharu was granted preservation of the family name and given status as hatamoto with 500 bales of rice.
Later, Hideharu was granted preservation of the family name and given status as hatamoto with 500 bales of rice.
Kuwayama family
Kuwayama family
Kuwayama family
Fudai (hereditary) lordship
Fudai daimyo (a daimyo in hereditary vassal to the Tokugawa family)
sen.cmt: 譜代 補足をしました。
sen.e: Fudai daimyo (a daimyo in hereditary vassal to the Tokugawa family)
12,000 koku to 10,000, 16,000 and eventually 26,000 koku.
12,000 koku to 10,000, 16,000 and eventually 26,000 koku.
12,000 koku to 10,000, 16,000 and eventually 26,000 koku.
